questions.text: A new combined treatment regimen of chemotherapy and immunotherapy has significantly increased survival in patients with metastatic melanoma. If the number of new cases remains consistent, but patients live longer, which epidemiological impact would be observed? (AIIMS NOV 2017)

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence reduces and prevalence remains the same

options.label: C
options.text: Incidence remains the same and prevalence increases

questions.correct_answer: C. Incidence remains the same and prevalence increases
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Incidence remains the same and prevalence increases

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When patient survival increases due to a new treatment, the incidence of the disease remains the same, but the prevalence increases due to longer survival duration.
  • ➤ When patient survival increases due to a new treatment, the incidence of the disease remains the same, but the prevalence increases due to longer survival duration.

questions.text: Which of the following laboratory test is used to diagnose rotavirus diarrhea? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: A
options.text: Antigen detection in the stool sample

questions.correct_answer: A. Antigen detection in the stool sample
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Antigen detection in the stool sample

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Antigen detection in stool samples is the standard diagnostic approach for confirming rotavirus infection, crucial for implementing appropriate management strategies, especially in managing dehydration risks in young children.

questions.text: Which of the following does not play a role in fetal growth? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Growth hormone does not play a significant role in fetal growth, while insulin-like growth factors and thyroxine are crucial for proper fetal development.

questions.text: During a major disaster response, the medical team in an emergency department needs to prioritize patients based on the severity of their injuries and their medical needs. This prioritization process is known as triage. Each patient is assigned a specific color code representing their current state and the urgency of their medical attention. Which of the following correctly matches the color designation with its corresponding level of patient priority in the triage process? (AIIMS MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Green – ambulatory

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Identify the blue-colored area shown in the image below? (NEET PG 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Mid-pelvis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The plane of the mid-pelvis (or mid cavity) is a crucial area within the true pelvis, significant for various clinical considerations during labor and delivery.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 92 Textbook of obstetrics by JB Sharma
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 92 Textbook of obstetrics by JB Sharma

questions.text: A 15-year-old boy, a known case of type I DM, undergoes the following test for the detection of KB. Which is this test: (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Rothera's Test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rothera's Test is a commonly used laboratory test to detect the presence of ketone bodies, specifically acetoacetate, in urine or blood samples. It is particularly relevant in the context of diabetes mellitus, as individuals with uncontrolled diabetes, especially type I diabetes, may experience an increase in ketone production.
  • ➤ In type I diabetes, the body is unable to produce sufficient insulin, resulting in a lack of glucose utilization by cells for energy. As a result, the body begins to break down fats as an alternative energy source, leading to the production of ketone bodies, including acetoacetate.

questions.text: As part of a health development project in rural India, you're asked about the key community group responsible for overseeing local health, sanitation, and nutrition initiatives. Which committee best fits this description? (AIIMS MAY 2018)

options.label: B
options.text: Village Health Planning and Management Committee

options.label: D
options.text: Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee

questions.correct_answer: D. Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The VHSNC plays a crucial role in the grassroots-level health planning and implementation in rural India, ensuring that health initiatives are tailored to the specific needs and conditions of the community. It is a vital part of the health ecosystem, facilitating a comprehensive approach to public health management in rural settings.
  • ➤ The VHSNC plays a crucial role in the grassroots-level health planning and implementation in rural India, ensuring that health initiatives are tailored to the specific needs and conditions of the community.
  • ➤ It is a vital part of the health ecosystem, facilitating a comprehensive approach to public health management in rural settings.

questions.text: Which of the following is a function of the marked layer? (INICET NOV 2023)

Educational Objective:

questions.text: During disaster management, triage is conducted to ensure proper treatment of casualties. What are the accurate aspects of the triage process carried out at the site of the disaster? (NEET PG 2019)

options.label: B
options.text: Green labels are for those who need to be transported on priority

options.label: C
options.text: Moribund patients receive the lowest priority

options.label: D
options.text: Most commonly used system is three color code system

questions.correct_answer: C. Moribund patients receive the lowest priority
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Moribund patients receive the lowest priority

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In disaster triage, moribund patients receive the lowest priority, allowing medical resources to be focused on patients with a higher chance of survival.

questions.text: A 27-year-old female patient presents with complaint of sudden diminishing vision. On examination, relative afferent pupillary defect is noted in the right eye and the left eye is normal. Which of the following investigations would you do next? ( INICET May 2022) MRI brain and orbit Myelin oligodendrocyte oligoprotein (MOG) and neuromyelitis optica (NMO) antibodies Blood sugar Thyroid profile
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1, 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of sudden visual loss with RAPD, it is crucial to perform a thorough diagnostic evaluation to determine the underlying cause. MRI of the brain and orbits, along with specific antibody tests for MOG and NMO, provide critical information for accurate diagnosis and appropriate management of optic neuritis and related conditions. Monitoring blood sugar levels is also essential, especially in the context of potential steroid therapy.

questions.text: The following image depicts: ( INICET NOV 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Production of monoclonal antibodies

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The process depicted in the images is the production of monoclonal antibodies using hybridoma technology.

questions.text: A 16-year-old presents with absent menses. Examination shows widely spaced nipples, webbed neck, and Tanner grade 1 breast development. USG shows streak ovaries. Investigation shows raised FSH, raised LH, and reduced estradiol. What is the diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Turner syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Turner syndrome is characterized by primary amenorrhea, streak ovaries, hypergonadotropic hypogonadism, widely spaced nipples, and a webbed neck.
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of Gynecology 3 rd edition pg411, Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg 441
  • ➤ Ref: William’s textbook of Gynecology 3 rd edition pg411, Dutta’s textbook of gynecology 6 th edition pg 441

questions.explanation: Ans. A. IX

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Southampton grading scale

questions.text: Imagine you are a clinician administering vaccines to a group of travelers going to a region with high Hepatitis B prevalence. One of the travelers, who has a background in biology, curiously asks which specific part of the Hepatitis B virus is actually present in the vaccine to induce an immune response. Out of the given options, which antigen is included in the Hepatitis B subunit vaccine? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) HbsAg

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Hepatitis B subunit vaccine contains HBsAg, which is essential for inducing an immune response against the virus.
  • ➤ The Hepatitis B subunit vaccine contains HBsAg, which is essential for inducing an immune response against the virus.

questions.text: Patient affected with acute hepatitis B infection has currently come for follow up. Identify the serological marker marked in the image? (AIIMS NOV 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Anti-HBc Ab

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Anti-HBc antibodies are crucial in diagnosing hepatitis B infection, as they appear early after exposure and persist throughout the infection. They are typically seen during the "window period" when HBsAg starts to wane and before Anti-HBs becomes detectable, indicating the body's initial immune response to the infection.

References:

  • ↳ Reference - Harrison 21E/Hepatology/Viral hepatitis/ chap 339/

questions.text: Affinity maturation is due to: (INICET NOV 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Somatic hypermutation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Affinity maturation, which results in the production of high-affinity antibodies, is primarily due to somatic hypermutation (SHM) of immunoglobulin genes in B cells, coupled with selective survival and proliferation of B cells producing high-affinity antibodies.

questions.text: Surgery where one nostril is partially or completely occluded is done for which condition? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Atrophic rhinitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Young's operation is a unique surgical technique reserved for severe cases of atrophic rhinitis where other treatments have failed. This procedure helps in restoring the normal function and structure of the nasal mucosa by temporarily occluding the nostrils to allow healing.
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7 th edition, Page No. 173
  • ➤ Ref - Dhingra 7 th edition, Page No. 173

questions.text: A 16-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with a history of increasing muscle weakness over the last several months. She complains of difficulty performing daily activities such as climbing stairs and lifting objects due to fatigue. Physical examination reveals significant proximal muscle weakness. Laboratory tests show elevated muscle enzymes, including creatine kinase and aldolase. The physician notes specific skin findings that raise suspicion for a diagnosis of an inflammatory muscle disorder. Which of the following skin findings is most specific for this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Gottron’s papules

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gottron’s papules are the most specific and pathognomonic sign of juvenile dermatomyositis, appearing as violaceous, flat-topped papules on the extensor surfaces of the fingers. Recognizing these lesions is critical for diagnosing juvenile dermatomyositis and differentiating it from other autoimmune or inflammatory conditions.

questions.text: A 28-year-old patient was brought to the casualty with high fever and pain in abdomen. He had a history of bloody diarrhea for several months. There was no past history of long-term medications and previous surgeries. The abdominal X-ray image obtained is shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis? (AIIMS NOV 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Toxic megacolon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The X-ray image shows a dilated loop of the transverse colon > 6 cm. The history of bloody diarrhea and loss of haustrations are suggestive of ulcerative colitis. Sudden onset of fever, abdominal pain with dilated loops of bowel in a patient with ulcerative colitis point towards toxic megacolon.
  • ➤ A plain abdominal X-ray film can indicate the severity of ulcerative colitis in the acute setting and is especially valuable in demonstrating the development of toxic megacolon. The next step would be to perform a CECT abdomen to assess status of bowel and urgent exploration may be needed if ischemia or perforation is seen.

questions.text: A 4-year-old child presents with easy fatiguability. The mother also complains that the child has increased hunger between meals, which is relieved after food. Liver examination revealed no glycogen. What enzyme is most likely deficient? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glycogen synthase is a key enzyme involved in glycogenesis, the process of synthesizing glycogen, which serves as a storage form of glucose in the liver and muscles. Glycogen synthase catalyzes the addition of glucose molecules to the growing glycogen chain by creating alpha-1,4-glycosidic linkages between glucose units. This enzyme is regulated by various factors, including insulin, which promotes glycogen synthesis by activating glycogen synthase.
  • ➤ Mutations or dysregulation of glycogen synthase can lead to Glycogen Storage Disease 0 (GSD 0), a disorder resulting from mutations in the GYS2 gene encoding liver glycogen synthase. C/f include fasting hypoglycemia, hunger between meals, hepatomegaly (enlarged liver), and other metabolic abnormalities due to impaired glycogen synthesis.

questions.text: A young girl presents with retention of urine and cyclical abdominal pain. On examination, there is a tense bluish bulge seen at the introitus. The diagnosis is? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Imperforate hymen

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of cyclical abdominal pain, urinary retention, and a tense bluish bulge at the introitus in a young girl strongly suggests an imperforate hymen. Early diagnosis and surgical intervention can prevent complications and relieve symptoms.

questions.text: Difference in trajectory between inspiratory loop and the expiratory loop in the curve is due to: ( AIIMS May 2017)

options.label: A
options.text: Difference in alveolar pressure during inspiration and expiration

options.label: B
options.text: Difference in conc. of surfactant during inspiration and expiration

options.label: C
options.text: Difference in airway resistance during inspiration and expiration

options.label: D
options.text: Inspiration is active and expiration is passive

questions.correct_answer: B. Difference in conc. of surfactant during inspiration and expiration
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Difference in conc. of surfactant during inspiration and expiration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The difference in trajectory between inspiratory and expiratory loops on a lung compliance chart is mainly due to variations in airway resistance, which is typically lower during inspiration and higher during expiration. This affects how easily air can be inhaled versus exhaled, impacting the shapes of the loops on the graph.

questions.text: Which statement most accurately refers to the requirements for initiating an urban community health center? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Caters to a population of 1-1.5 lakh

options.label: B
options.text: Referral centre for 2- 3 primary health centers

options.label: C
options.text: No sub-district and district hospitals present in the area

options.label: D
options.text: Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

questions.correct_answer: D. Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Should have a 100-bed facility in metro cities

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: Which among the following indicates severe COVID-19 ? (INICET MAY 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) SpO2 < 85% on room air

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe COVID-19 is indicated by an SpO2 of less than 85% on room air.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man with a history of seizure disorder has been successfully managed on phenytoin for several years. Recently, he was diagnosed with peptic ulcers and prescribed sucralfate to be taken four times daily. He experiences worsening seizure control shortly after starting the new medication. His physician suspects a drug interaction between phenytoin and sucralfate. To ensure optimal absorption and effectiveness of phenytoin, what should be the minimum duration of time between the administration of these two medications?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When administering phenytoin and sucralfate together, it is crucial to separate their intake by at least 2 hours to prevent sucralfate from interfering with phenytoin absorption. This ensures that the antiepileptic drug maintains its efficacy without being hindered by the ulcer-protective effects of sucralfate.

questions.text: The best method to measure HbA 1c is? ( AIIMS May 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Ion exchange chromatography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ion-exchange chromatography is considered the gold standard for measuring HbA1c due to its high accuracy and ability to separate HbA1c from other hemoglobin variants based on charge differences.

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a known history of diabetes mellitus presents with a BP of 150/90 and dizziness. What is the best way to manage this patient? ( INICET Nov 2023)
questions.correct_answer: D. Diet, Exercise, Lifestyle modification + Amlodipine
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Diet, Exercise, Lifestyle modification + Amlodipine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For hypertensive diabetic patients, it is essential to start pharmacological therapy along with lifestyle modifications to reduce cardiovascular risk. Amlodipine is an appropriate choice for initial therapy in this context.

questions.text: A gynecologist performs a hysterectomy for endometrial carcinoma. Despite the adequate precaution, the ureter was injured intraoperatively. The gynecologist is not held responsible under? (AIIMS MAY 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Medical maloccurence

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Medical maloccurence is critical to understand that not all adverse outcomes in medicine result from negligence. Some are inherent risks of medical procedures despite the highest standards of care. Recognizing this helps in managing patient expectations and can protect healthcare providers in cases where complications arise despite proper precautions.
  • ➤ Medical maloccurence

questions.text: The hormone acting on post ovulatory endometrium is? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Progesterone

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Progesterone is the hormone responsible for preparing the endometrium for implantation during the post-ovulatory phase.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 94, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 94, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition

questions.text: The organism with following life cycle is: (INICET MAY 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Strongyloides stercoralis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The life cycle of Strongyloides stercoralis involves skin penetration by filariform larvae and autoinfection.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis of the image shown below?(AIIMS NOV 2018)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Coxa vara

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The given image in the question shows coxa vara i.e., reduced angle between the neck and shaft of the femur.
  • ➤ The given image in the question shows coxa vara i.e., reduced angle between the neck and shaft of the femur.

questions.text: A female patient presents to the AIIMS emergency department with severe fatigue and prostration. She is a known case of chronic stable angina. While collecting a blood sample, you notice the blood has a brownish hue. What is the underlying diagnosis? (INICET NOV 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  C) Methemoglobinemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A brownish hue in the blood, especially in a patient on nitrate therapy, is indicative of methemoglobinemia, a condition where hemoglobin is oxidized, impairing its ability to carry oxygen effectively.

questions.text: What is the active principle of the poison shown in the image? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bhilawanol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The active principle of the marking nut (Semicarpus anacardium) is Bhilawanol, used in traditional practices for its staining and toxic properties.

questions.text: A 26-year-old female domestic worker reports to the forensic unit following an alleged sexual assault by her employer. During the forensic examination, white stains are observed on her clothing. The stains are subjected to Barberio's test to detect specific seminal components. Which of the following substances is identified by Barberio’s test?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Spermine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Barberio’s test is a forensic method that identifies spermine, a component of seminal fluid secreted by the prostate gland, by forming yellow needle-shaped crystals of spermine picrate with picric acid. This test is useful in detecting semen in forensic cases, particularly when investigating sexual assault.

questions.text: In atrial fibrillation, choose the correct statements: (INICET MAY 2021) Novel oral anticoagulants (NOACs) used in the treatment of moderate to severe MS Anticoagulants should be given in patients with ischemic stroke due to atrial fibrillation NOACs are contraindicated in prosthetic valves All patients with atrial fibrillation who are not candidates for cardiac surgery can be started on beta-blockers
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2 and 3 correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anticoagulants are used for ischemic stroke in AF, and NOACs are contraindicated in prosthetic valves.

questions.text: Assertion : Decompression surgery is needed with progressive neurological difficulty in Pott’s spine. ( AIIMS May 2019) Reason : Even after completion of ATT, there can be neurological abnormalities.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently a true/correct statement but the Reason is independently an incorrect/false statement

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently a false/incorrect statement but the reason is independently a true/correct statement

questions.correct_answer: B. Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Both assertion and reasoning are independently true/correct and reason is not the correct explanation of the assertion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When there is stage 4 of pott’s spine with bladder/bowel involvement and more than 50% of sensory loss, the treatment of choice is decompression surgery with bone graft, along with continuation of ATT. Even after the completion of ATT, there can be presence of neurological abnormalities.
  • ➤ When there is stage 4 of pott’s spine with bladder/bowel involvement and more than 50% of sensory loss, the treatment of choice is decompression surgery with bone graft, along with continuation of ATT.
  • ➤ Even after the completion of ATT, there can be presence of neurological abnormalities.

questions.text: Which of the following is a dematiaceous fungus? (INICET NOV 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cladosporium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cladosporium is a dematiaceous fungus, characterized by its dark pigmentation due to melanin in its cell walls, and it is associated with various diseases including phaeohyphomycosis, chromoblastomycosis, and eumycotic mycetoma.
  • ➤ Cladosporium is a dematiaceous fungus, characterized by its dark pigmentation due to melanin in its cell walls, and it is associated with various diseases including phaeohyphomycosis, chromoblastomycosis, and eumycotic mycetoma.

questions.text: A 13-year-old boy collapsed while playing football. ECG showed V5, V6 inversion and prominent inverted T-waves. 2D echocardiography showed the septal anterior motion of mitral valve leaflet. Which of the following features will be seen on clinical examination and which of the following are true regarding the management? (INICET NOV 2020) Clinical findings a. Pulsus bisferiens b. Pulsus alternans c. Ejection systolic murmur d. Murmur increases on standing e. Murmur decreases on standing Management 1. Beta-blockers are given 2. Beta-blockers are contraindicated 3. ICD is indicated 4. ICD is contraindicated
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Key Points:
  • ➤ Key Points:
  • ➤ All murmurs decrease on standing except MVP and HCM.
  • ➤ All murmurs decrease on standing except MVP and HCM.
  • ➤ Pulsus bisferiens can be seen in HCM
  • ➤ Pulsus bisferiens can be seen in HCM
  • ➤ HCM is characterized by myocyte disarray & fibrosis causing increase risk of sudden cardiac death & arrhythmias.
  • ➤ HCM is characterized by myocyte disarray & fibrosis causing increase risk of sudden cardiac death & arrhythmias.
  • ➤ Pulsus alternans is seen in LVF
  • ➤ Pulsus alternans is seen in LVF

References:

questions.text: Which of the following effects of puberty are not mediated by estrogen? (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hair growth

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hair growth during puberty is mediated by testosterone, not estrogen. Estrogen is responsible for breast development, internal genitalia development, menarche, growth spurt regulation, epiphyseal closure, and cervical mucus secretion.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 531, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 531, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Gynecology, 6 th edition

questions.text: A 30-year-old male from a remote village presents to the clinic with gradually worsening skin lesions that have been present for over a year. He reports that some areas of his skin have lost sensation, making it difficult to differentiate between hot and cold objects. On examination, there are multiple hypopigmented patches with partial loss of sensation. The patient has not received any prior treatment. A nasal smear shows acid-fast bacilli. The clinician discusses the possible progression and spontaneous remission rates of the disease if left untreated. Which of the following statements correctly describes the likelihood of spontaneous healing in untreated leprosy?

options.label: A
options.text: Tuberculoid leprosy has a higher remission rate compared to indeterminate leprosy.

options.label: B
options.text: Approximately 50% of individuals exposed to Mycobacterium leprae develop clinical symptoms.

options.label: C
options.text: Indeterminate leprosy has a higher rate of spontaneous remission compared to tuberculoid leprosy.

options.label: D
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy frequently undergoes spontaneous healing without medical intervention.

questions.correct_answer: C. Indeterminate leprosy has a higher rate of spontaneous remission compared to tuberculoid leprosy.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Indeterminate leprosy has a higher rate of spontaneous remission compared to tuberculoid leprosy.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Indeterminate leprosy is characterized by higher rates of spontaneous remission compared to other forms of leprosy, such as tuberculoid leprosy. Recognizing the natural history of untreated leprosy is crucial for understanding its clinical course and potential for self-resolution.

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant G3P2L2 woman presented to OBG department at 36 weeks of amenorrhea. Ultrasound shows that the fetus is in a transverse lie. The liquor is adequate, the placenta is normal, and she has no gross anomaly. Both her previous deliveries were normal vaginal deliveries. How will you manage this patient? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) External cephalic version

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ External cephalic version should be attempted between 36 and 37 weeks of gestation for a fetus in a transverse lie if there are no contraindications.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presented with weight gain, proximal muscle weakness, purple striae, and easy bruising. What is the likely underlying condition? (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hypercortisolism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cushing's syndrome, or hypercortisolism, is characterized by weight gain, proximal muscle weakness, purple striae, and easy bruising due to the catabolic effects of excess cortisol.

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy rapidly develops hypoglycemia after moderate activity. Blood examination reveals raised levels of ketone bodies, lactic acid, and triglycerides. On examination, the liver and kidneys are found to be enlarged. Histopathology of the liver shows deposits of glycogen in an excess amount. What is the diagnosis? ( AIIMS May 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Von Gierke's disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A primigravida presents to the labor room at 40 weeks of gestation with lower abdominal pain. She has been in labor for 3 hours. Which of the following will determine if she is in active labor? (NEET PG 2022)

options.label: A
options.text: Fetal head 5/5 palpable on abdominal examination

options.label: B
options.text: Two contractions lasting for 10 seconds in 10 minutes

options.label: C
options.text: More than 5 cm cervical dilatation with complete effacement

questions.correct_answer: C. More than 5 cm cervical dilatation with complete effacement
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) More than 5 cm cervical dilatation with complete effacement

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Active labor is determined by more than 5 cm of cervical dilatation with complete effacement, according to the WHO Labor Care Guide.
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 138, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics, 8 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 138, DC Dutta’s Textbook of Obstetrics, 8 th edition

questions.text: Which of the following events occur immediately when a person changes his/her posture from supine to standing? ( INICET May 2020)

options.label: B
options.text: Vagal output to cardiac fibres increase

questions.correct_answer: A. Decrease in firing from baroreceptor
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Decrease in firing from baroreceptor

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The immediate response when a person changes posture from supine to standing is a decrease in baroreceptor firing due to a reduction in mean arterial pressure.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after being caught in a bomb blast at a railway station. He has multiple small puncture wounds on his left chest and several small abrasions scattered across his body. He is conscious, and his vital signs are stable. On examination, there are no signs of penetrating deep trauma, but numerous superficial injuries are visible. Which of the following mechanisms is most likely responsible for these injuries?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Secondary blast injuries

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Secondary blast injuries are caused by fragments and debris propelled by an explosion, leading to penetrating wounds, lacerations, and abrasions. The classification of blast injuries

questions.text: An 18-year-old female presents with severe headache and high fever of 101°F. On examination, papilloedema and nuchal rigidity was present. Gram staining of the CSF is shown below. What is the Causative organism? (NEET PG 2019)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Neisseria meningitidis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Neisseria meningitidis - Intracellular gram-negative diplococci in gram staining.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Human genome project? (INICET May 2022)
questions.correct_answer: D. It took 2 years to discover
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) It took 2 years to discover

Explanation:

  • • Explanation: Option D is false. The Human Genome Project did not take only 2 years to complete. It was a long-term endeavor that spanned over a decade. The official launch of the project was in 1990, and a working draft of the human genome was announced in 2000. The project was completed in 2003.
  • • Explanation:
  • • Relevance: This statement is false, and the actual timeline of the Human Genome Project demonstrates that it was a multi-year, collaborative effort.
  • • Relevance:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A. Collaboration of Many Countries:
  • • Option A. Collaboration of Many Countries:
  • • Explanation: The Human Genome Project was indeed a collaborative effort involving many countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, and others. It aimed to map and sequence the entire human genome. Relevance: This statement is true and reflects the international nature of the project.
  • • Explanation: The Human Genome Project was indeed a collaborative effort involving many countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Japan, and others. It aimed to map and sequence the entire human genome.
  • • Explanation:
  • • Relevance: This statement is true and reflects the international nature of the project.
  • • Relevance:
  • • Option B. 20,000 Total Genes Were Identified :
  • • Option B. 20,000 Total Genes Were Identified :
  • • Explanation: During the Human Genome Project, it was estimated that there are approximately 20,000-25,000 protein-coding genes in the human genome. This estimate is relatively accurate, considering the complexity of the human genome. Relevance: This statement is true and reflects one of the significant achievements of the HGP.
  • • Explanation: During the Human Genome Project, it was estimated that there are approximately 20,000-25,000 protein-coding genes in the human genome. This estimate is relatively accurate, considering the complexity of the human genome.
  • • Explanation:
  • • Relevance: This statement is true and reflects one of the significant achievements of the HGP.
  • • Relevance:
  • • Option C. It Uses Modern Sequencing Techniques:
  • • Option C. It Uses Modern Sequencing Techniques:
  • • Explanation: The Human Genome Project utilized state-of-the-art sequencing techniques of its time, which included automated Sanger sequencing. These techniques were considered modern at the start of the project in the early 1990s. Relevance: This statement is true, considering the technologies available during the project's duration.
  • • Explanation: The Human Genome Project utilized state-of-the-art sequencing techniques of its time, which included automated Sanger sequencing. These techniques were considered modern at the start of the project in the early 1990s.
  • • Explanation:
  • • Relevance: This statement is true, considering the technologies available during the project's duration.
  • • Relevance:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Human genome project started in 1990 and completed with sequence of Y chromosome this year in 2022. So, it took > 2 decades. This was a collaborative project spread across many labs in different countries across world. Approximately 22000 genes were identified in entire Human genome using High throughput Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) techniques.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Harper’s 30 th ed/pg- 98

questions.text: Fructosamine (which is used for assessing long term glycemic control in a person with hemolysis) is a glycated product of: ( INICET Nov 2022)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Albumin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Glucose can be attached to proteins, albumin, and also to RBCs forming HbA1c. Fructosamine is term used for all the glycated proteins including glycated albumin.
  • ➤ glycated albumin.
  • ➤ In hemolysis patient, HbA1c analysis cannot be done because it will be falsely decreased due to damage to RBCs and loss of hemoglobin. So, fructosamine determination is used for these patients.

questions.text: A patient presented with jaw swelling and weight loss. Suspecting a malignancy, the submandibular gland was resected. Which is the most likely nerve to be damaged during submandibular gland resection?(NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Lingual nerve

Educational Objective:

questions.text: What importance does the point labelled as 'C' hold? (INICET MAY 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Onset of symptoms

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ The onset of symptoms marks the transition from the subclinical stage to the clinical stage of disease.

questions.text: Female on maize as a staple diet. History of diarrhea and lesion in the neck region. It is due to deficiency of: (NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Causes of pellagra
  • ➤ Causes of pellagra
  • ➤ Maize and Jowar in Diet: The major protein of Maize, “Zein” lacks tryptophan which is required for Niacin biosynthesis. 60 mg of tryptophan gives 1 mg of Niacin in the body. So, pellagra is more common when maize is the staple diet due to decreased synthesis of Niacin. Jowar has high content of leucine which inhibits tryptophan to Niacin conversion. Carcinoid syndrome: In this, Trp is mainly used for serotonin formation causes deficiency of trp for Niacin synthesis. Malabsorption Drugs like Isoniazid as isoniazid inhibits PLP (B6) formation which in turn is required for Niacin synthesis. Vitamin B2 is also required for Niacin synthesis, so, a deficiency either of B2 or B6 or both can cause pellagra.
  • ➤ Maize and Jowar in Diet: The major protein of Maize, “Zein” lacks tryptophan which is required for Niacin biosynthesis. 60 mg of tryptophan gives 1 mg of Niacin in the body. So, pellagra is more common when maize is the staple diet due to decreased synthesis of Niacin. Jowar has high content of leucine which inhibits tryptophan to Niacin conversion.
  • ➤ Maize and Jowar in Diet:
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome: In this, Trp is mainly used for serotonin formation causes deficiency of trp for Niacin synthesis.
  • ➤ Carcinoid syndrome:
  • ➤ Malabsorption
  • ➤ Malabsorption
  • ➤ Drugs like Isoniazid as isoniazid inhibits PLP (B6) formation which in turn is required for Niacin synthesis. Vitamin B2 is also required for Niacin synthesis, so, a deficiency either of B2 or B6 or both can cause pellagra.
  • ➤ Drugs like Isoniazid

questions.text: Most common hernia in females (INICET MAY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Indirect inguinal hernia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In females, the most common type of hernia is the indirect inguinal hernia, despite femoral hernias being more common in females compared to males.
  • ➤ Incidence of Hernia in Females: Indirect inguinal Hernia > Direct inguinal Hernia > Femoral hernia

questions.text: A patient had a femur fracture for which internal fixation was done. Two days later, the patient developed sudden onset shortness of breath with low grade fever. What is the likely cause? (AIIMS MAY 2017)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fat embolism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fat embolism is the most common complication of femur fracture. It usually presents 48 hours after the injury with breathlessness and low grade fever. The patient remains asymptomatic in the initial 12-48 hours.
  • ➤ Fat embolism is the most common complication of femur fracture.
  • ➤ It usually presents 48 hours after the injury with breathlessness and low grade fever.
  • ➤ The patient remains asymptomatic in the initial 12-48 hours.

questions.text: The table provided illustrates a multivariate analysis assessing the relationship between the risk of blindness and various factors including age, literacy rate, place of residence, and gender. Which of the subsequent statements accurately interprets this data? (INICET MAY 2022) Female population is at greater risk of developing blindness. People dwelling in rural areas are at increased risk of developing blindness. Risk of developing blindness increases with age. Illiteracy leads to increased risk of developing blindness.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 3 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Odds ratio interpretation:
  • ➤ Odds ratio interpretation:
  • ➤ Odds ratio of 1: Indicates that the risk factor is not related to the disease. Odds ratio less than 1: Indicates that a person with the disease is less likely to have been exposed to the factor, implying that the factor may be protective. Odds ratio greater than 1: Indicates that the factor is associated with an increased risk of the disease.
  • ➤ Odds ratio of 1: Indicates that the risk factor is not related to the disease.
  • ➤ Odds ratio of 1:
  • ➤ Odds ratio less than 1: Indicates that a person with the disease is less likely to have been exposed to the factor, implying that the factor may be protective.
  • ➤ Odds ratio less than 1:
  • ➤ Odds ratio greater than 1: Indicates that the factor is associated with an increased risk of the disease.
  • ➤ Odds ratio greater than 1:
  • ➤ p-value interpretation:
  • ➤ p-value interpretation:
  • ➤ p-value < 0.05: Indicates that the result is statistically significant. p-value > 0.05: Indicates that the result is not statistically significant.
  • ➤ p-value < 0.05: Indicates that the result is statistically significant.
  • ➤ p-value < 0.05:
  • ➤ p-value > 0.05: Indicates that the result is not statistically significant.
  • ➤ p-value > 0.05:

questions.text: Consider the following actions under AMTSL. Arrange them in the right order? (INICET NOV 2022) Uterine massage Give uterotonic (oxytocin 10 mg) Exclude the presence of another fetus Controlled cord traction AMTSL- Active management of the third stage of labor.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 3, 2, 4, 1

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The steps of Active Management of the Third Stage of Labor (AMTSL) should be followed in a specific order: exclude the presence of another fetus, administer a uterotonic, perform controlled cord traction, and then provide uterine massage.
